page.title: 02GOOLE PARISH CHURCH
page.content: The Goole Parish{Church}of St John was built between 1843 and 1848 on land near the docks given by the Aire and Calder Navigation Company. In 1983 extensive repairs were needed to prevent the plaster ceilings from falling in.The church launched a STOP THE ROT{campaign}in February 1983 with appeals to local industries and businesses for financial support.It was estimated that Â£100,000 was needed for essential{repairs}to the church. In June 1985 after countless fund raising events such as discos,concerts and sponsored events etc. by many different organisations in the town, over Â£55,000 has been raised. Repairs including new ceilings,new lighting and roof repairs are well underway.The people of Goole have responded magnificently to{preserve St John's for many years to come.
